label: Description
value: Ivory brisé fan carved and pierced to resemble lace with figures, boats, houses, trees. Guards carved in high relief.

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1908: Mrs. Paul Dana collection; 1908: acquired by the Museum.

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam. (a,b): 1.1 x 6 cm (7/16 x 2 3/8 in.)

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam.: 3 x 8 cm (1 3/16 x 3 1/8 in.)

value: Trimming or ribbon with a flower and leaf motif in silver, repeated at intervals on ground of white silk with red silk borders.

value: Design for a garden pavilion. Pavilion with umbrella decorated with flower motif. Vegetation surrounds pavilion. Scale noted at bottom.

value: Design for half-moon bridge in garden pavilion. Flower motif decorates balustrade and supports of bridge. Vegetation drawn on left side of bridge. Scale noted on bottom.

value: Gift of Mrs. Abram S. Hewitt
Design for Pagoda in Garden Pavilion

label: Description
value: Conical roof supported by pillars, balustrade decorated with flower motif. Pillar decorated with circular designs. Table drawn in middle of pagoda. Scale noted at bottom.

value: Gift of Mrs. Abram S. Hewitt

label: Description
value: Drawing of large pavilion surrounded by foliage. Hexagonal pavilion comprised of slanted roof supported by columns with circular design decoration and lanterns. Balustrade at base decorated with flower motif. Small level on roof of pavilion.

value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on wove paper, lined

value: Gift of Mrs. Abram S. Hewitt
Design for Wallpaper: Birds on Stands

label: Description
value:
Eight birds on perches enclosed by arced branches, in four horizontal rows, and staggered in alternate
rows.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink on laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Design for paisley (Persian woven cone). A small cone containing a flower bough sits inside a larger one, curved at the top in the opposite direction and showing a dotted field. The edges of the larger one are lined with leaves.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and orange-pink gouache on brown oiled translucent paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier and Sarah Cooper Hewitt, New York, NY; 1909: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: In the same style as 1909-13-106. Lozenge scehem composed of triangles and squares. Four horizontal rows in blue and white are to alternate with four rows in blue and lateritious color. Three different kinds of inner divisions are skeetched for the white and lateritious squares.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, blue, lateritious, and white gouche on oily tracing paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1909: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: The top row: torus moulding in the shape of a laurel garland with a medallion with a six-pointed star. Second row: three bead mouldings. Third row: a frieze with appliqués. In the middle is a palmette motif; at the ends two rosettes of different designs. Fourth row: a torus moulding in the shape of two garlands connected by a shell (?). Fifth row: a torus moulding consisting of laurel garlands springing from chalices, which are separated by a rosette and two chalices. Bottom row: a torus moulding in the shape of an oak garland springing from a shell, and surrounded by a ribbon with palmettes.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, pen and black ink, brush and grey watercolor, brush and black on light creamy paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1909: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Elongated quatrefoils with four circumscribed lilies and a five-pointed star on dotted ground are staggered in alternate overlapping horizontal rows. The stars rise from crescents and from suns in alternate rows and the quatrefoils are connected by orthodox churches on clouds and mosques upon palmettes in alternate horizontal rows.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and lateritious gouache, brush and white, purple paint on oily tracing paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1909: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Copies of Romanesque Letters and Motifs for a Woven Fabric

label: Description
value: Top left, center: two quatrefoils and lozenge motifs. Top right: Romanesque letter "F". Left center: Romanesque letter "B". Center, in opposite direction: a shield in the center of two intertwined quatrefoils. Bottom left: four rows of perspectively shown coffers with red points. Bottom right: Romanesque letter "O".

label: Physical description
value: Brush and lateritious, purple, blue, and light green gouache on oily tracing paper

value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1909: acquired by Museum

Design for a Woven or Printed Fabric or Wallpaper

label: Description
value: One repeat is shown consistsing of undulated rising flower stems which are crossed at the bottoms by a horizontally disposed bough. Right bottom: figures, in pencil. Verso: account and remnants of another line: "3 pieces"; the last line: "3- frames".

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and purple watercolor on paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1909: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Shown are the central motif, the mask, the right half of the remaining design. A bust of a wild man emerges from a leaf. He carries with raised arms a bowl with a head hare, a dead peacock and fruits. A rinceau springs from the leaf. A running dog is shown in the lower spiral. Another sits upon the upper one. Above is a trophy of hunting weapons and objects with the mask of a horse in the center above.

label: Physical description
value: Black chalk, pen and black ink, brush and blue, black watercolor on paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1909: acquired by Museum

value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
